definition: Ashoka (304-232 BC), Indian emperor of the Maurya Dynasty 孔雀王朝[Kong3 que4 Wang2 chao2], ruled 273-232 BC
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
flatter
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
to have children/to raise or bring up/to educate
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
surname Wang
to rule/to reign over

sentences.english: This being the case, there was no reason for Asoka to discuss Buddhist philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 從這個角度，阿育王沒必要在這裏討論佛教哲學。

sentences.english: The "Great Stupa" was constructed by Emperor Asoka some time in the third century BC.
sentences.chinese: 這座“大佛塔”爲阿育王在公元前三世紀所建。

sentences.english: Ashoka officials say there is no set amount.
sentences.chinese: 阿育王的官員說，沒有固定數目。
